--

What does Free and Open Source software (FLOSS) provide to artists and
designers - beyond just free alternatives to established tools from Photoshop
to Final Cut?

"FLOSS+Art" is the first book to answer this question. It shows how the value
of Free Software lies in its differences and creative challenges, as opposed to
out-of-the-box and off-the-shelf solutions; how it allows to work and
collaborate differently with computers, and therefore enable different kinds of
art and design.

The Internet - whose infrastructure is based on free software and open
standards - is an obvious example of such an adaptable, collaborative artistic
medium. "FLOSS+Art" also covers more traditional artistic domains such as
graphic and audiovisual design, and how they shift from customer-centric to
community-driven work.

--

ABOUT THE BOOK:

FLOSS+Art critically reflects on the growing relationship between Free Software
philosophy, open content and digital art. It provides first-hand insight into
its social, political and economic myths and realities.

With contributions by: Fabianne Balvedi, Florian Cramer, Sher Doruff, Nancy
Mauro Flude, Olga Goriunova, Dave Griffiths, Ross Harley, Martin Howse, Shahee
Ilyas, Ricardo Lafuente, Ivan Monroy Lopez, Thor Magnusson, Alex McLean, Rob

ABOUT THIS PACKAGE

Rather than just providing a "free" PDF, FLOSS+Art.v1.1.eBook-GOTO10 contains
all the Fonts, Images, and Scribus source files that were used to make the
book. All the material is triple licensed GNU GPL, GNU FDL and Free Art license
and the fonts used are either GNU GPL, SIL OFL or both (See Fonts folder for
details).

Feel free to branch a translation or fork the chapters! ;)
